website_summaries.verdict: This tunnel playset is packed with fun features, backed by an impressive warranty, and a close contender for the best.
pros: Designed with an adorable "spaceship" tent that appeals to young, budding astronauts
Also has a spacious tunnel and basketball pit
Customer service and money back guarantee provide peace of mind
cons: Fairly large, so it may not fit areas with limited space
Assembly isn't too difficult, but takes a little more time than some comparable play sets

customer_reviews.title: Tent was an amazing birthday gift for my 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: Tent was an amazing birthday gift for my 1 year old. He loves going through the tunnel. We opted to not fill it with balls and just use a small basketball. He is starting to get the hang of it. I also have an 11 and 9 year old who can fit in there (even the tunnel) but I do not recommend that for constant play. They showed him how to crawl through the first time and he loved it. Pops up and goes together easily. Holds up well so far. No rips or tears. We even has a pup run through it before we could catch her. Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Find a different one, this one is a terrible waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. It doesn't come with instructions to assemble but it's not rocket science to put together. The tunnel only attaches to the spaceship, it does not attach to the ballpit. There is an opening for the tunnel in the ballpit but since it does not attach, the balls dont stay in, they just flow out the poorly designed pit. It's extremely flimsy, my 11 month old rolled over in it and as he rolled into the side the entire ballpit turned over dumping the balls out. Avoid this one and find one that isnt so cheaply and poorly put together.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Underhill

customer_reviews.title: Rocket is okay, the rest is great
customer_reviews.text: Ball pit and tunnel are amazing but the rocket has torn in several spots and we have only had it 3 months. It tears easy and the beams fall down every time the kids play. I tied them in but the ties broke off a few weeks ago. UPDATE: ROCKET IS DESTROYED. Every single pile is broke and my finger is filled with splinters after removing them. save your kids the heartbreak! I am so mad! Only 6months of joy and it's worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: So the most important thing is, my son LOVES this thing. It occupies him for minutes upon minutes, which is fantastic. The artwork is fun, the tent is big, and he absolutely gets a kick out of sitting in there with mom and dad. The downside is, parts of the construction are a little on the weak side. We've had it set up for just a couple days and two of the ties that hold the tunnel onto the ship have already ripped. Granted, our toddler is pretty rough on it, but he's a toddler, so there's not much I can do there. With the ties ripped, balls come out the sides and make a bit of a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Grandson's Rocket
customer_reviews.text: My two 13M Grandsons love the ball pit and tunnel. It's great to see their faces light up when we they get close. The setup is simple and I had up ready for the kids in no time. It its not very stable but I have it on the basement floor so it's not staked to the ground. I've noticed the kids will pull the rocket over as they crawl through the tunnel unless I add some weight in the rocket. The only real negative is the tunnel is tied to the rocket and ball pit. These ties do not keep the items tight and tend to come untied. I'm considering add Velcro ties to better attach the three pieces.
customer_reviews.author: FinCo - Steve

customer_reviews.title: My kids (and cats) love it
customer_reviews.text: This is great, we bought it for my sons first birthday party and had a bunch of kids using and abusing it and it survived! Also my cats really enjoy it. We bought 400 balls to go in it and that’s a good number to fill the bottom but it could fit more if you’re feeling brave. I wasn't the one that opened it so I have no idea how to get it bent back into the storage bag and that’s the only downside to it which I don’t think even counts, that’s operator error. Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LoraLeighAddict

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for long term enjoyment
customer_reviews.text: As an older momma, I can remember the times when I needed the momma quiet break. Where could I let my kids play while I cooked, took a shower or even sat down for a break. Well, when my kiddos where younger we used a blow up pool and play plastic balls. The Playz Rocket ships adds a new level of excitement and imagination. This easy to pop up and store away play tent offers a momma her much needed rest, while allowing the young children to safely play. This is a great toy that will offer hours of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Strong material and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought this for my grandson, who is one, he is so cute playing in the tent. He loves playing in the ball pit and crawling through the tunnel. Usually by no one-year-olds don’t have a long attention span but he’s been playing with it now for over a week since he got it for his birthday and he still loves it it’s in great condition it’s very Versatile it’s strong no rips or anything and he’s been playing in it like I said every day. Versatile it strong no rips or anything and he’s been playing in it like I said every day
customer_reviews.author: Roben L. Dearman

customer_reviews.title: It sets up very fast and easily, with or without the directions
customer_reviews.text: My son is two and came around the corner on Christmas morning to find this thing set up in the living room. He immediately jumped into the ball pit and we couldn’t get him out of it! I’d say that’s about as rousing a review as you’re likely to find! It sets up very fast and easily, with or without the directions. I wish it came with more balls, but they’re readily available and pretty cheap, so it’s not a knock on the rating at all. Great gift for the little ones!
customer_reviews.author: Cary D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: confused
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, so I can't say if it works great or not yet, but it seems decent. So far we have 200 balls in it and it's not enough. I need to buy more. This is what set of balls I got if you were wondering...  I can't tell how to attach the tunnel to the ball pit. There are all sorts of ties on the tunnel, but there's nothing to attach them to except one spot. There should be more!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I will not reccomend this
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product to any parent who’s kids are smart and curious . The kids who love to really play this is not a product for them. The canopy which is standing on some stupid sticks broke while assembling. The sticks are not a good idea at all. A lot of loops were missing too. In less then one weeks time it has become trash for us. I would love to go back in time and never have ordered this for my sons birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Atif

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Functional
customer_reviews.text: With stay at home orders, this tent, tunnel and ball pit was perfect for transforming a spare room into a homeschooling playroom. It was fairly easy to set up. I was able to fill the ball pit with 500 large size balls and still could have gone for another hundred but this was a good amount. The rocket ship tent is huge and connects to the tunnel with 4 attached ties and tabs. Overall a great value and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: LGA

customer_reviews.title: Fun Set!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 and 3 year olds for Christmas. They love it! Easy to set up and take down. Stores very compact, which I love. The kids can leave readjust the set-up if they want (take the tunnel or ball pit on/off). We haven't put balls in it (I know they will just end up all all over the room), but they love having the extra "space" to crawl around in. Oddly enough, one of our cats seem to be the biggest fan of this...she is constantly in it when we have it set up.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this thing. I definitely think it’s worth the money. But it isn’t made out of super sturdy material. So if you have pets, like I do, keep them out!! Their nails might rip the fabric. The ball pit is also super easy to cave in, if it isn’t completely full of balls. And btw to fill the ball pit you’ll need probably about 300+ balls. We bought 100 thinking it would be plenty and we were definitely wrong. But it’s still worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Portable Fun for the grandkids
customer_reviews.text: The grandkids love this. Big fun that folds very small, so it is easy to store (not the balls obviously, which were bought separately). The tunnel is a net on the top, so the toddler was not scared to crawl through it and we could see him laughing, which is priceless. It isn't heavy material, so we'll see how it stands up later. The pit itself was a bit harder to fold, but we found directions with demo on YouTube so Grandpa folded it and all was right in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma H

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor camping on a rainy day!!
customer_reviews.text: My munchkin could not contain his excitement the second I took this toy out of the box! We'd been having a lot of summer rain and I told him it was on it's way... By the time it arrived, it was a rainy evening and he couldn't wait to use it to "go camping" (in his room ;)... We set up "the campground" and he had so much fun!! Since then he's used it for more camping fun, pretending he's going on space adventures in his rocket ship, making a pit of stuffed animals and pillows to play in... Just hours and hours of fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Anile

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product except...
customer_reviews.text: The only complete is the tunnel should attach to the tent and ball pit via velcro. I say this bc there were some strings that weren't attached and/or missing. Also, when the entire 3 pcs are set up, the balls can sneak through the holes that attach the 3 pieces. Other than that, this product is excellent for sturdiness, fun for the kids and safe safe safe.
customer_reviews.author: CO Sigmund's

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product for the price! My 2 year old loves it. He has the ball pit and tunnel downstairs, and the rocket ship in his room. My only complaint is that I HATE how the balls keep sliding into tunnel (or through gaps connecting tunnel) and out everywhere on the floor. Omg, it’s a nightmare to pick up (I filled it with 800 balls!). I had to create my own system where I plug up his tunnel (which kind of defeats the idea of having a tunnel to crawl through) with 2 really fluffy couch pillows. I would totally give product 5 stars if they could give option to seal off that hole (without gaps!).
customer_reviews.author: Cecile

customer_reviews.title: The poles are flimsy and dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Its cute and the reviews seemed like it was going to be sturdy enough. My 1 &1/2 Year old was in it the first day and He doesnt know how to play rough he just kinda sits in there but he leaned on the side and one of the support poles snapped and sprayed microscopic shards of fiber glass that luckily, only got in my skin and not his as i was taking him out. Very dissapointed as the price point was kind of high for an extremely cheaply built tent and a potentially dangerous one at that. It did come a day earlier than expected so ill give the sellers that much. But i certainly wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Williams

customer_reviews.title: The Rocket Ship Tent Set is the Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: The Rocket Ship Astronaut Play Tent set was a perfect birthday gift for my great granddaughter's third birthday. She is having fun playing in it with the 400 balls I bought her. Her little brother will be able to play along with her in it after his infancy is over. I like the fact that you can use part of it whenever you don't want to use the whole thing. The Rocket tent can also be used outside. An added benefit is, this is a STEM product and educational.
customer_reviews.author: reggaelady

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: It essentially is put together like a tent with the poles that go together. Not too bad to set up, but definitely not something you want to set up and take down repeatedly. My son loves this though. It does take up a lot of room, but that’s okay, we have some space for it. My son loves it and my husband has even managed to wiggle through the tunnel with my son.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Other than it has been a fun adventure toy for my son to explore
customer_reviews.text: When this item arrived I was kind of surprised with how large it was! My 1 year old son loves playing in the tubes and the ball pit area. It is kind of tricky folding back up and I wish it included the balls for the ball pit area. Other than it has been a fun adventure toy for my son to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Cook

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!  My toddler will love this!
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised to see this show up compressed in such a small bag. But, sneaky sneaky...it's quite large, and looks like it's fairly well-built. I think my toddler will love this. I already had a bunch of ball pit balls, so didn't have to order those, but make sure you read the details as it's just the play areas, and does not include any balls.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It's a Rocket Ship, but for my Living Room!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for his first birthday. Filled it up with 250+ balls, and he seems to enjoy it. The rocket ship was easy to assemble and seems sturdy enough. Time will tell if it's durable or not, but so far it's an awesome present. It does take up quite a large area of my living room, so be mindful of your living space before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: jtoth

customer_reviews.title: This is just a wonderful thing to have for kids on a rainy day ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just a wonderful thing to have for kids on a rainy day or for the winter months in MN. I let my two year old nephew try this out for me and he LOVED it. He played in for a couple of hours and was fully entertained the entire time. I am so happy with this purchase, how quickly it came, and how easy it was to set up. It is a compact item when you need to fold it back up at store it away.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy but cute.
customer_reviews.text: I loved it... before my kid got into it... it is cute, have to admit... BUT!!!! The little tube in the middle is very flimsy. I hated it. Didnt last a day. The ties ripped while my ONE year old tried crawling through. Used for only a moment before i packed it away. I guess you have to be “careful” while using it but lets be honest, what kid will be tiptoeing in this, none...
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: So nice and easy to set up! Educational & Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and we love it. I can't wait for our grandkids to visit and see this. It came in a nice zippered carrying bag. It was very easy to set up and looks very nice and I think will provide lots fun and education at the same time. We wanted this for our grandson who is almost 2 yr old and our granddaughters who are 3 yrs old and it's perfect. Its so cute we may just leave it up in our family room. Although I was very impressed how it all fit in a small carrying bag and will be easy to store anywhere. I highly recommend this for the price, education and fun!
customer_reviews.author: MUHerdFan

customer_reviews.title: Great Indoor/Outdoor Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly what I expected of it. Holds on pretty well and my son and his friends had a blast at his birthday party. The three parts kept getting detached, but I think that’s due to us not tying it well enough. But it help pretty well considering there were 6 toddlers and 2 older kids playing there at the same time. The only down point is folding it back so it can fit in the bag. They included instructions, but they don’t explain the proper way to fold the part with the basketball hoop, so that could be better. Regardless I’m very happy with the purchase and would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Cute, kids love but not the sturdiest
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my space loving boys. Very easy to use, hours of fun but not sturdy. It would be nice if the ball put could stay closed so balls don’t escape too. My boys love it, and because they live it so much it’s splitting at the seams. I tried to sew a few parts but I’m not sure how long it will hold.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Our son is in heaven! This is a very large and easy to assemble tent. The graphics on the sides are bright, bold, and super cute. He loves taking his balls and putting them through the basketball hoop. Eventually we will get small plastic balls to fill up the ball pit side but for now he's enjoying his new hideaway space.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Super-fun, a little flimsy in construction
customer_reviews.text: Our 14-month-old daughter took to the ballpit instantly! I am concerned that the walls of the pit are too flimsy - she has already started folding them down when she's trying to get out, instead of crawling through the tube to the official rocketship door. And I do echo some others' concerns about the connections between the tube and the other two parts. They feel like they'd be easy to rip off. But no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Etan Rosenbloom

customer_reviews.title: love/hate relationship with this product
customer_reviews.text: 18 month old grandson loves this. He likes the rocket. We tried to put the balls in the rocket part but because the floor is flat with no lip the balls will not stay in this part. We put up the ball pit hoping the balls would stay in but he is to young to explain that the balls stay in the pit area. He dumps them on the floor. We ended up giving him about 20 balls and pick them up constantly. He likes the product now but I believe he and his parents will like it better when he is two years old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Hit!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for his birthday, and he loves it! He is younger than the stated age range, but he knew exactly how to crawl through the tunnel. We have not filled it with the balls yet. I am sure he will love it even more when we do.
customer_reviews.author: Ann C

customer_reviews.title: A hit for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This rocket ship play tent will be a hit for kids. With a tunnel, ball pit and small basketball hoop, any kid will enjoy the variety in their own home. The colors are eye-catching. This is easy to put up with four detachable rods for the castle part. Disassemble is very easy with taking down the rods, and twisting it all into a flat circle, inserting it all into the enclosed bag. An innovative play place for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Mayjar

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but it doesnt' come with the balls
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this and had a lot of fun. For the price, it was worth it, and quite large! However, I didn't read that it didn't come with the balls. So Grandpa headed out to find them. He bought 400 balls (to the tune of $48) and it filled it maybe 25%. So just know that you are going to need at least 1200-1500 balls, and they are not cheap. That's why I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Navarre

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, looks nice BUT the frame is made of wires that HURT when your knees crawl on them through the entrances and the tunnel. My kid has bruises all over his shins after using this. I had to remove the tunnel and place pillows at the entrances to keep his knees and shins from getting hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo C.

customer_reviews.title: We love that it folds down for storage (although we still ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our son's first birthday and it was a big hit. We love that it folds down for storage (although we still haven't gotten down the proper way to fold down the ball pit). There are toggles and ties to attach the pieces together but like other reviewers I am concerned with them staying intact with future play. I may just install extra ties and toggles myself in the extra space between toggles/ties.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Family

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for the little one!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 1 year old boy for his birthday and he loves it. Constantly crawling from the ball pit through the tunnel and into the rocket ship tent. Love the basket hoop that comes with the ball pit. Our little one enjoys putting the balls through the hoop. It's sturdy for what it is, but our little one tries to support himself on the tent or the wall of the ballpit and would just fall over. Not a big deal since we're supervising. Great fun for the little one! And it takes up our entire living room!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Yip

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sons Birthday and boy does he love it!! I set it up in the basement and so far it has provided hours and hours of fun. I also purchased a package of Nurf balls for him to use and that has helped him to enjoy this set even further. The rocket ship set was very easy to set up and it was fun to do along with my son. He got a kick out of the tunnel that just pops open. I reccomend this to anyone looking to have fun with their kids or to just get a little break.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Peters

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This tent/tunnel/ball pit set is a lot of fun for our 8 month old! I like that the ball pit has a tying flap over the opening so that it can be used by itself (although I wish the tent also had a tying flap over the side opening). We ordered 500 balls (2.5 inches), and that is more than enough to put in the ball pit with a toddler. For our infant who likes to crawl around and explore, we only use about 150-200 balls, which is just enough to line the floor and still be safe for him.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 3 weeks...don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely adorable...but didn't even last a month! All 4 corners...Where the poles go in the tent portion...Created large holes in the seams! :( Only lasted a few weeks..Also the ball pit portion...the wiring on bottom started to show through. My son loved it...And cried when I had to box up to return. Will try a different manufacturer! Tried uploading pics...But wouldn't allow me!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are 4 years old and LOVED playing with it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my twin god children. They are 4 years old and LOVED playing with it ! I set it up for them in less than 5 minutes, but they played with this tent and pretending they were "space people traveling to the moon" for 4 hours straight. I don't have balls to put in the ball pit but we just used that for the "engine". This tent fit a 25 year old adult and 2, 4 year old twins very comfortably ! Awesome, amazing gift for kids. They will LOVE it ! They even want to use it outside to camp and have a sleep over! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Beth H.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Fun
customer_reviews.text: Buy. This. Thing! My 5 year olds fit. My 80 lb puppy fits. I fit in this. It's huge! Who knew something so silly would be the source of hours and hours of fun. The amount of entertainment we have gotten out of this thing so far has absolutely justified the price.
customer_reviews.author: spinaz

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than the photos look like but still fun!
customer_reviews.text: The product instructions are not useful, but its fairly simple to put together. Undo the cords and allow the three separate items to open. Then stretch out the tube and place between the basketball pit and the rocket ship. You can tie together and then its best to sit inside the rocket ship and place the "tent" like poles into the ships sides and tie on. Once completed you are set to go!
customer_reviews.author: savvy buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids and easily stored in its own bag.
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept. The grandkids loved it. It sets up easy and quickly, and is taken down easily and stored in its own bag that is easy to store. The balls are purchased separately and are fun. It has a net to shoot the balls. I gave it four stars instead of five because I had to keep reinserting the rocket ship stakes and reposition the tube. In addition, I'd like to know about how many balls to purchase to fill the ball pit, (as pictured). I bought 200 balls and it barely filled the pit. Keep in mind, the kids loved it and kept their attention longer than any toy they got for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: E. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Our granddaughter loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter had a wonderful time playing in the space ship. We also got some balls for the ball pit and she had a fantastic time playing basketball for the first time, and sliding around in the balls. It was easy to put together. A bit bigger than I expected, but that was not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schiff

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! Easy to assemble and large sized.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, much larger than we anticipated. In the tourette a 6ft man 220lbs will fit and have plenty of room for 2 toddlers. We actually purchased for a 15 month toddler even though the manufacturer recommends 3 years of age. She loves it! We will need many bags of balls for the ball pit. Again we thought it would be smaller. You will want to use in a living room or family room.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Laffler

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is 1 year old and we gave him this tent and he loves it. It states it's for a 3 year old and up, but it works for a 1 year old just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Dunker

customer_reviews.title: What a bummer
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would have been a neat pop up tent for my son. I didn’t realize there are rods needed to assemble the tent which defeated the purpose of the pop up tent. I also wanted to use it outside-but the material is so flimsy I’d be afraid it would tear. If fact, it feels like it could easily tear just from playing on the carpet in the house. And folding back to fit inside the bag is nearly impossible for the ball pit, despite directions. I was very disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things! I already have one for my house, this one will go to the elementary school that I work at. Our first graders will love to have quite reading time in the tent and ball pit as a reward for positive behavior! It is durable enough that I will not even have to think twice about the kids being rough on it. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Great play area, Sturdy and Easy to Setup!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old daughter loves this play tent, we filled it with the recommended play balls and it's awesome! Really only needed about 200 balls to be full and still have room to play, but if you want it totally packed I'd recommend at least 400. Only drawback is that in the rocket ship opening there's nothing really keeping the balls in, so if it's packed the balls will just tumble out on that side. Definitely sturdy enough for small children, even keeps my 70 pound dog from bringing it down. Excellent product! Would definitely order from them again!
customer_reviews.author: JJJoey

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the kids entertained!
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love this. It is easy to pop up and tie together and just as easy to fold down and store away. The fold flat for convenient storage. Keeps them entertained for a while from hiding to playing basketball on the minihoop. Perfect for rainy days and for outside days as a sunshade,
customer_reviews.author: Brittany C. Reed

customer_reviews.title: It’s fun but cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: It’s HUGE. Make sure you have plenty of space for it. Also tip for parents, I ordered 200 balls. You definitely need more! I did notice the fort already tore from activity. We haven’t tried to fold it down but it’s gotta be tough, it’s pretty big.
customer_reviews.author: CandaceK

customer_reviews.title: Super fun for wide age range
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son. He is only a 1 year old but loves playing with the balls in the ball pit. He also loves crawling through the tunnel and playing in the tent. I love this item because it's great for him now and he'll have plenty of time to grow into it as well. We also really love the fact that it can be separated into separate pieces. It is very large so we had to take the tent portion off to fit in our space but it works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 9 month old for Christmas. He has so much fun going through the tunnel and playing in the ball pit. He also is fascinated with all of the pictures inside the rocket playhouse. He will be able to have fun with this for many months to come. The only thing I suggest is thoroughly vacuuming everything before use and supervise with small children. There were a few red flaky pieces that came off, I'm sure just loose from manufacturing. And yes, I know it says 3 yrs and older, but we did not see any small pieces or potential harm to letting our adventurous little boy play in this.
customer_reviews.author: kB

customer_reviews.title: First birthday party hit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's first birthday. He LOVES to play with balls, so the ball pit was his favorite! I purchased 200 balls for it, and it nearly filled the entire pit. He also loved crawling through the tunnel and playing in the rocket ship tent. Too early to tell how well it'll hold up, but he sure is having fun with it. The reaction that he had when he saw the bag full of all the colorful balls was priceless! I would have loved something like this as a kid, as I loved forts. This is very colorful and cute! I think he'll have many years of enjoyment with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Richard

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this tent and ball pit. However, it is very, very low quality. The pockets for the poles to go in are sewn in the wrong place (near the top instead of near the floor) so the tent poles don’t stay in place. They are starting to rip the floor of the tent. We have been using it for less than a month and it is already ripped on both sides of the doorway into the tent. Very, very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did so much research before buying this play tent, and I’m so glad I found this one. First of all, it’s HUGE!!! A few adults could sit in the tent part, even the ball pit. It’s very well made, and feels solid when it’s set up. It was very easy and pain free to set up, took about 15 minutes. You can tie the 3 parts together, or separate them how you want. The design is unique and it definitely stands out from the hundreds of play tents out there. I have to wait and see how it holds up with toddlers, but I can’t say enough great things about it right now!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Fenoglio

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons 1st birthday and he LOVES it!! My 5 year old also loves playing in it, too, so it’s been a hit to have in the house. I do wish the tunnel connected to the pieces better, but that’s a wish list, not a reason to dislike it.
customer_reviews.author: SHEA S.

customer_reviews.title: Splinters
customer_reviews.text: We only used the tent and love it but 18month old kept messing with the rods that are supposed to stabilize and keep the tent upright. For the longest I kept getting splinters in my hands after handling but couldn’t figure out from where until I had to take one of the rods out because the string holding it in place tore off. I’m going to hate to throw it away because my plan was to sew the string back in place but since little one keeps touching the rods I didn’t want to take the risk of her getting splinters from the rods too.
customer_reviews.author: Alva

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our sons to play with, aged 15 months and almost 4 years. I feel like you get what you pay for with this tent. It's not the best quality as our son ripped off one of the ties from the tent to the tunnel on the second day, but he's also pretty rough with things. But it's a cute play structure and the boys have enjoyed it. I'm unsure if I would buy it again but I don't think it was a bad purchase either.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F

customer_reviews.title: Fun for being stuck in the house
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my boys have been stuck in the house for 5 month and were going crazy. They absolutely loved this tent/ballpit! It was pretty easy to put together I just had my husband hold the top of the tent to make it easier to put the poles in, other than that I did it myself. I'm still trying to figure out how to fold the ball pit to put it back in the back, that's why I didn't give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney P.

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to assemble and I love that it comes in ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail today and my kid LOVES it! We may buy another one for the backyard or grandma’s house! The tent itself is much bigger than I expected. Both my son and I can fit in there together, or multiple toddlers can pile in during a play date! It was very easy to assemble and I love that it comes in a convenient storage/travel bag. It collapses down super small so it won’t take up much space in the car or closet.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product came in a timely manner and packaged quite efficiently. It opened up to be much much bigger than expected but thats okay. It's always good for outside in the summertime. If there is one thing I would say needs improvement it would be how to fold the ball pit to fit back into the packaging. Reminder that this product does not come with balls for the ballpit.
customer_reviews.author: Asayroo

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for fun at home!
customer_reviews.text: We used this ball pit at a friend's house and our daughter loved it so much we knew it was going on the Christmas list for this year! The set-up was easy and it's big enough that mom or dad could get in to sit with smaller kids. The only improvement I would recommend is more balls with the initial purchase - we purchased a second bag and still feel like the ball pit could use some additional filler. We'll probably order 1-2 more just to make it extra fun. Overall, great toy and burns off kid energy which is always a plus!
customer_reviews.author: UTBen05

customer_reviews.title: He loved it. It doesn’t not come with balls
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my almost 2 year old nephew. He loved it. It doesn’t not come with balls. I bought 300 balls but I think 500 would have been better. The tunnel is actually large enough for an adult to squeeze through and even my linebacker size brother in law made it through the tunnel. Our nephew loved it and played in it all day.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A. Black

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves it! He will drop any toy to play in the ball pit or sit in the rocket ship area. Only issue is that it’s not very durable. The seams doorways are already coming off and the ties that have the bars to hold up the tens rocket ship thing are also coming undone. I got this for my nephew for Xmas, so it’s only been a month and it’s already starting to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for overprotective parents
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my nephew’s first birthday based on the Amazon description stating multiple times it was suitable for a 1 year old. Open the package and it says it’s for 3+ years and there is a warning saying not suitable for children under 36 months. Warning if you buy this for protective parents. No idea what the “small parts” could be, but still not happy about the contradictory descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this! When put together she has a really cool play house with balls that she loves crawling through. I love that you can take the pieces apart or only use 2 of them so that you can make different places for them to play. We put away the tunnel and ball pit this morning and set up the space ship as a tent in her room for a few days. She loves crawling in there with our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Covington

customer_reviews.title: Great play and safe space for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this for my dog for Christmas! He loves his rocket ship tent! His round bed fits perfectly in the tent and he loves going down the tunnel to get his tennis balls from the ball pit section! He also lays in the tent with his stuffed animals when we leave to go to work or run errands. It's like his safe shelter. Love this so much!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie McWilliams

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to put together it’s pretty big which is what ...
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together it’s pretty big which is what I was looking for. I have a 6 year old boy and 2 year old girl and needed something for them to both play in. My only complaint is the material is cheap. It started ripping and tearing in the rocket ship and the ball pit part 3 days after using it. Also the ball pit is extremely hard to fit back into the case so I just leave it out.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.  Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made..it was ok for a couple weeks of playing. The largest part the seat in tent/castle will not stand up anymore. It's very thin material. I wish I kept the package it came in. Because. It would be sent back. Very disturbing in the item
customer_reviews.author: Mary K Gatts

customer_reviews.title: Good, just wish it was more sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my little boys, one of my sons has autism and he loves the sensory aspect of playing in the ball pit. However, I do wish it was more sturdy, this is made to be used and played with by kids.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was pictured! Great size and lots of space to move around for multiple kids. The material is kind of cheap though and had a rip in it on the all pit when we first opened it which is very disappointing. I also wish it was possible to connect the tent with the ball pit so you don't have to have the tunnel. I made it work with twist ties but it's not the best connection.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ottolini

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I had given this previously 3 stars but that is too generous at this point. After only 5 uses the poles have bent and my kids are super disappointed. Definitely would not recommend this. Should be more durable for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Firechief24

customer_reviews.title: Waste of your money
customer_reviews.text: Product started to tear right after return window. I would highly advise against purchasing this. It's a short term toy. I have a 2 year old and this thing is breaking withing about a month of limited use.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Toddler’s indoor fun for winter
customer_reviews.text: Toddler loves it! Especially the basketball hoop and all the windows to look into. Take note that the rods for the rocket tent have a definite “right side up” which you can tell based on how they line up with the seams of the tent. Learned this after I installed three upside down, then accidentally installed the fourth correctly. Easy to fix, so no big deal. I took off a star because there are some minuscule holes (barely noticeable) in the material, but hopefully won’t cause trouble later on. I looked at a lot of tents and tunnels, and I think this one is worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Esther Terry

customer_reviews.title: Very Cute but two ties broke within the first 10 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to set up and cute but the ties that join the pieces together are faulty. I tied a bow instead of a knot to be cautious and on the first time of my son crawling through the tunnel a tie broke. He weighs 23 pounds and was not being rough with it. The next time he went through the opposite tie broke as well, it is really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This playpen is fantastic. My kids were entertained for the whole day. I bought 1000 balls (sold separately) and it filled the space perfectly. The stitching is robust and despite little ones leaning/hanging on stuff, the structure stayed intact and deformity-free. This is a great product. If I had one suggestion, it would be instructions on how to fit everything back into the carrying case. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this set!
customer_reviews.text: My one-year old son loves this play set! We chase each other through it, he tosses balls into the basketball hoop, and we spend time together in the rocket ship reading books together and pretending to go into space. Overall, I am happy that my son is so happy with it. Few things....the set is very large. Having all three pieces out took up a lot of space so we took down the ball pit and left the other two pieces up. Second, I wish the material used was a little higher quality. Nothing has torn yet, but I can't imagine this toy lasting very long.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: He loves it, but it has ripped a few places within a few days.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my toddler for Easter. He was really excited by it and kept saying "Whoa!" when he saw it, but it is not as safe and sturdy as I would like. Just with the first assembly, the fabric ripped a little while putting the poles in. My son has also very easily messed up the poles and created more rips. Granted, he's an active kid, but something aimed at kids should last a little better. Otherwise, it is a great tent and he has enjoyed it. For the cost, it's not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer McCulley

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I already have 2 Poles that are splintering I have had to put tape on them to keep my grandson from getting splinters its fiberglass. The ball Pitt is fun easy to put up but good luck in trying to fold it up to put it back in the bag. The tube is a lot of fun for my grandson. Really if I could do something with the polls that keep the tent up and the ball pit Fold up, It's not a bad gift or just something to hang around the house for the kids or grandkids. Where the poles slide in on the inside of the tent have already tore.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include balls
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of this gift for my grandson's first birthday. Bought it. It arrived and I quickly realized my $60 gift was going to be a $110 gift as I had to buy the balls separately. I'm not sure if I simply over looked this, or perhaps a comment about the balls coming separately would have been nice. I suggest raising the price and including all a toddler would need to enjoy this.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again...but some minor tweaks would make it better
customer_reviews.text: For the price and overall use this item is great. I do with the basketball hoop wasn't on the same part as the tunnel. It would make it better for placing against a wall. I also think there could be a better opening for the pit itself, like a dip on one side to step over, when the pit is full. Also be aware you can't fill this too high because of the design of the tunnel. You can remove the tunnel and put down the velcro strap. Overall, very easy to put together and my boy loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had better construction.
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept and my son loves playing in it, however it broke within the first day. There are strings that tie the pieces together and they are not very sturdy. The one string broke off and now I can’t even rig it back together so the balls spill out even with the tiniest movement. Would love the see a way to keep the balls contained in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: re stitch is a must
customer_reviews.text: Edit after year of use it’s been torn apart and in the garbage won’t last much longer even if you restitch it. great for 3 months max. easy use and put away but really really cheap material, i had to re stitch the whole thing because it was falling apart after a week of use
customer_reviews.author: Yessenia Luna Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Get 200 plastic balls and get ready to invite a team of kids over to have some fun. The size is perfect and good for kids up-to six years old. The kids also love story time in the rocket. A word of caution, it takes time to setup or put away, but having a group over to play makes up for the putting away.
customer_reviews.author: dfaf

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy for my kids. They've had a blast playing in this for days now. It helps that we have a large play room. Otherwise the balls would drive me crazy since they never stay in the ball pit.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Only finished assembly, not start using yet, so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and installed all the pieces together. I felt I would love it if I could have one back in my childhood. The only one complaint so far is the one-page introduction. Maybe it can be printed on a nicer piece of paper? And also the rubber band inside the tent poles feel loose, which makes me worry about how hard the tent can hold before failing if a kid inside leaning against it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seams tore on the first day.
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made. The seams where the pieces tie together tore on the first day of use. My son loves this play tent so much but it's already tearing apart from minimal use from a 3yr old. The seems should be reinforced. For $50 I would expect it to last more than a day. Very disappointed in this low quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used it a lot yet, but my son really enjoys it so far. We don't have balls in the ball pit area, but he uses it for stuffed animals or what not. We like that you can have it all together or in separate parts. It's not super easy to put together with the poles for the tent, and it could be held together better with the closures between the separate areas. Generally, though, it's a good product, and we're happy we bought it. We like that it folds up easily for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Fun for you! I mean the kids, yeah... the kids!
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought this to our two year old, and he absolutely LOVES this! Awesome quality for the price we paid. We’ve had it for about 6 months now and it’s still in great shape, and we have dogs who enjoy playing in it as well, and it’s still going strong! My husband and I both fit in the rocket ship part with our son. We’re pretty big people, I’m 5’9 and he’s 6’2, so it’s a pretty good size! Must by, for playful boys! They will LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee Pike

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and holds up well if it’s a little breezy. Kid loves it! Only con might be that the plastic ties become detached pretty easily if kids get rowdy playing in it (and not even that rowdy). So we can’t attach the tunnel as well anymore, but all you have to do is place either end of the tunnel inside of the tent or ball pit and it’s fine. Would recommend as my 4-year-old loves it and will play in it for awhile I imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Megan N

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: be careful not to brake the rocket holders because my kids did by accident and the inside material of the holders felt like small needles. so I took away the rocket but left the other part and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get, very weak construction.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is exactly what you see and what you might imagine. My kiddos love it, 3yr old and 18mos, they spend hours playing in it. With that said I really wish the material was better quality or in the very least do reinforced stitching on all seams. I got it for my babes 3rd bday in March it has been up since and it is now July and it already ripped as of 2 months ago, so yes 2 months later it ripped. I will try to show you photos later as I upload them.
customer_reviews.author: Tami N.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease of set up, one thing I did was to put blankets over the wire forms so their little knees would not be hurt while crawling through the tunnels and kneeling on the wire, which keeps the form of the product. My four grandchildren (ages 0 to 6) will be so excited when they come today, it is a surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Wis resident

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing toy for the price! It really delivers. It all folds up easily and nicely for storing. So simple to pop together. The rocket ship stays up all the time for my grandson to have his own little man cave and be with mom and dad at the same time. When his friends are over they use every piece of this set and it keeps them busy for hours laughing and using their imagination. Oh and yeah, I have caught both mom and dad playing in the rocket ship!
customer_reviews.author: Lyfox

customer_reviews.title: Huge, no balls included.
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I read the reviews before buying this and realized it doesn’t include ball or balls, which is kind of disappointing, but whatever. Also, this is really really big! Unless you have a large play room or expect to use this outside, it’s almost to big for a regular bedroom or living room set up.
customer_reviews.author: Max N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this! It was very easy to set up and it’s easy to take down and move around. Right now we have all three pieces in three different places. Some of the ties that hold the pieces together broke the first day we used it, but they were easy to sew back. That first day was at a birthday party with some wild toddlers. We haven’t had any issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year Old Loves This
customer_reviews.text: It says 3+ but we got it for a 1 year old for his birthday and he is really having a blast crawling through it. Takes up a good amount of space so make sure you have room for it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Haning

product_meta.title: Playz 3pc Rocket Ship Astronaut Kids Play Tent, Tunnel, & Ball Pit with Basketball Hoop Toys for Boys, Girls, Babies, and Toddlers - STEM Inspired Educational Galactic Spaceship Design w/ Planets
feature_bullets: ASTRONOMY TOYS FOR KIDS ★ Your child will take off into an outer space adventure with this 3-piece playhouse castle tent, crawl tunnel & basketball pit with hoop. With our one of a kind space shuttle rocket ship design, their imaginations will come alive as they enjoy endless hours of space exploration while crawling & playing in the playland ball pit.

NASA BABY APPROVED ★ We were inspired by dozens of little kids opinions which led to our innovative child-friendly & educational design. Soft thick fabric, breathable mesh walls, and flexible padded structure gives your child the safest enjoyable experience. Playz toys always meet & exceed all USA CPSC Toy Safety Guidelines.

FAST INSTANT ASSEMBLY ★ Portable, durable, easy to setup & foldable into a lightweight zipper carrying bag for convenient storage underneath your couch! The tunnel, tent & ball pit can be used all together, as a 2pc set, or individually using the velcro cover for tunnel openings. PLAY PIT BALLS ARE NOT INCLUDED.

MULTIPURPOSE SPACE STATION ★ Purchase with Playz Pit Balls under ASIN B07C57J7VQ. Use the play set at parties, picnics, backyard BBQs, parks, playgrounds, day care, school, carnivals, sleepovers, or just keep it in the nursery. Give it as a christmas gift to 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, or 8 year old girls and boys. Excellent for your little dogs and cats as a pet tunnel or play cave as well

TRUST OUR PLAYZ GUARANTEE ★ You are purchasing from a real family operated small business that truly cares about our customers happiness and satisfaction. Contact our friendly Playz staff at anytime and we guarantee to give you an excellent after purchase experience. Cheers!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,151 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
